reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: F.a: Leadership Development in Women?s Economic, Social and Cultural Rights in South Asia

description.narrative: The gender equality perspective has so far been relatively little concerned in the implementation and international monitoring of the ESC agreement, and women's active participation in the UN monitoring mechanisms except CEDAW is scarce. All South Asian co untries have ratified the ICESCR and the CEDAW. The project aims to strengthen the South Asian women human rights actors? knowledge and understanding of ESC rights in order to promote women's rights in the national and international level and to influence development of the paradigm of women's ESC rights, in particular the South Asian region. The objective is that the women who participate in the training program gain skills and tools so that they can apply the ESC rights frame in their work for the strengt hening of the national implementation of the women? rights, and to approach the structural causes of the poverty, discrimination and inequality by human rights based perspective. Immediate target group of the project consists of 20 women and men human righ ts activists participating in the training program. The real beneficiaries are the marginalized community members, for whom rights to the organizations of persons involved in the training program the work for. PWESCR in India in 2005 to set up human rights organization that focuses on women's human rights , particularly economic, social and cultural rights.PWESCR is a human rights organization founded in India in 2005, which is focused on women's human rights, particularly economic, social and cultural righ ts. www.pwescr.org and www.pwescrleadership.org
